environment.logic.entities

Class HitBox

  • java.lang.Object
    • environment.logic.entities.HitBox

  • public class HitBox
extends java.lang.Object
    Denotes the outer boundaries of the region of pixels given by a GraphicalObject. This class also handles the implementation for detecting a collision between two entities.
    Author:
    Joshua_Eddy
    See Also:
    Entity, GraphicalObject

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      HitBox(GraphicalObject object)
      Constructs a new HitBox object.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean equals(java.lang.Object o) 
      java.lang.Integer[][] getHorizontalBoundaries()
      Retrieves the right and left boundary for each row of pixels.
      The row on which the boundaries lie is indexed by Integer[][].
      The left boundary is given by Integer[][0].
      The right boundary is given by Integer[][1].
      java.lang.Integer[][] getVerticalBoundaries()
      Retrieves the upper and lower boundary for each column of pixels.
      The column on which the boundaries lie is indexed by Integer[][].
      The upper boundary is given by Integer[][0].
      The lower boundary is given by Integer[][1].

        getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • getHorizontalBoundaries

        public java.lang.Integer[][] getHorizontalBoundaries()
        Retrieves the right and left boundary for each row of pixels.
        The row on which the boundaries lie is indexed by Integer[][].
        The left boundary is given by Integer[][0].
        The right boundary is given by Integer[][1].
        Returns:
        The Integer[][] denoting the horizontal boundaries of the HitBox.
        See Also:
        GraphicalObject, Entity

      • getVerticalBoundaries

        public java.lang.Integer[][] getVerticalBoundaries()
        Retrieves the upper and lower boundary for each column of pixels.
        The column on which the boundaries lie is indexed by Integer[][].
        The upper boundary is given by Integer[][0].
        The lower boundary is given by Integer[][1].
        Returns:
        The Integer[][] denoting the vertical boundaries of the HitBox.
        See Also:
        GraphicalObject, Entity

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object o)
        Overrides:

        See Also:
        HitBox, Entity
